thread.title: Disney apologizes over Twitter post on Nagasaki atomic-bomb anniversary
thread.title_full: Disney apologizes over Twitter post on Nagasaki atomic-bomb anniversary

title: Disney apologizes over Twitter post on Nagasaki atomic-bomb anniversary
text:
0 
The Japanese translation described the day as "not special," prompting sharp criticism from readers who questioned the timing of the tweet. "Why are you offering congratulations, Disney-san?" said one. 
Japan holds solemn ceremonies each year to mourn the more than 74,000 people killed in the bombing of Nagasaki on Aug. 9, 1945, three days after the first atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima. 
Japan surrendered on Aug. 15, ending World War II.
